ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson looks to Leo with seriousness but with an air of professional calm.  In this case, I feel it s best to meet them all at once.  This scenario happened

Tucson looks to Leo with seriousness but with an air of professional calm. =


" In this case, I feel it's best to meet them all at once.  This scenario=
 happened to me at one time and of all mechs I had to get tangled up with, =
it happened to be Sunstreaker and Sideswipe.  At the time they felt that th=
ey were the hot shots of the Autobot faction and they felt I was just anoth=
er slow moving, fuel hungry off roader, like Trail Breaker, Hound, Beach Co=
mber and even Ratchet.  Although they had the spark to ridicule Ratchet beh=
ind his back, it was another story when he was around them.  "

He sighs.

=
" Ratchet and I had a lot in common, mostly our short tempers and low toler=
ance for ridicule by fellow soldiers.  That too was something I got ridicul=
ed for.  One day they went too far with their snide commentary and I got in=
to a severe altercation with the two of them.  I'm not proud of this mind y=
ou, but I can't deny that it happened.  The fight ended with considerable d=
amage to me and the two of them, but more so to them.  Ultra Magnus had to =
literally pry me off of them because of the strength advantage I had over t=
hem.  It wasn't long before we were all brought to Optimus Prime due to our=
 dispute that I admit that I started, and he was not happy with all three o=
f us.  He did not discriminate against any of us and gave us our reprimands=
 as equals all at the same time.  He then told us that the lesson to be lea=
rned was that we needed to work as a team if we're ever to get over our dif=
ferences.  The brothers were not thrilled about that and neither was I .  B=
ut we still did as we were instructed, we worked together during a weeks ti=
me, learning how to cooperate and learn about who we really were on the ins=
ide.  We never thought it would work until.."

He gives a sigh.

It was dur=
ing one of our famous battles on Cybertron, we were under heavy fire by the=
 Seekers and and they were much faster in flight than we were on wheels.  S=
ide Swipe was on my left and Sunstreaker was on my right, a good distance a=
head.  I tried to keep up with them but at the time my alt form was more su=
ited for strength rather than speed.  It took only one shot from the seeker=
s to destroy the road ahead of me, taking the twins with it.  At that time =
our differences meant nothing to me and I quicky shifted into robot mode, w=
hile still in motion, mind you, I slid on my chest for a good twenty feet, =
reached out and caught their back bumpers just before the fell hood first i=
nto a large bottomless void, created by the seekers.  They quickly transfor=
med but I still held onto them.  As soon as they turned around, I retained =
my position so they could climb to safety.  I was never in so much pain in =
my life after that but for the first time, they were extremely thankful for=
 what I had done, and they apologized for all the ridicule they inflicted o=
n me and so I did the same and we shook hands.  After that, we embraced eac=
h other, thankful we all made it out in one piece.  I have a feeling the sa=
me could be so with my sister, Rattrap and Wheelie.  But they may need more=
 than just a week."

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Aug =
25, 2011, at 9:42 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> LE=
O PRIME glanced over at his console as it beeped at him. "Wheelie
> has arr=
ived in at the Ark again. Did you want to see them one at a
> time or toget=
her?"
> 
> LEO was letting TUSCON run his troops again, but he was still ke=
eping
> an optic open to be sure that he would be the leader they would nee=
d.
> Perhaps a leader who thought 'out of the box' so to speak would be
> g=
ood. But too far out of the box could get them all killed. And there
> was =
still the matter of TUSCON's anger.
> 
> Yes, LEO PRIME still continued to =
watch TUSCON's way of commanding,
> hoping that he would prove to be the le=
ader the Maximals needed.
> Meanwhile he still kept the call out for all Ma=
ximals to return to the
> ark, there were other groups out there still retu=
rning.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-48-967939164

v></div><blockquote type=3D"cite"><div>




<span style=3D"display:none">&n=
bsp;</span>



    <div id=3D"ygrp-text">
      
      
      <p>LEO PRIME =
glanced over at his console as it beeped at him. "Wheelie<br>
has arrived i=
n at the Ark again. Did you want to see them one at a<br>
time or together?=
"<br>
<br>
LEO was letting TUSCON run his troops again, but he was still ke=
eping<br>
an optic open to be sure that he would be the leader they would n=
eed.<br>
Perhaps a leader who thought 'out of the box' so to speak would be=
<br>
good. But too far out of the box could get them all killed. And there<=
br>
was still the matter of TUSCON's anger.<br>
<br>
Yes, LEO PRIME still c=
ontinued to watch TUSCON's way of commanding,<br>
hoping that he would prov=
e to be the leader the Maximals needed.<br>
Meanwhile he still kept the cal=
l out for all Maximals to return to the<br>
ark, there were other groups ou=
t there still returning.<br>
<br>
(TAG)<br>
<br>
Preston<br>
</p>
